Guys..

 Edit each manifest.xml for each dlc and remove the part that says RequiresAuthorization="0" completely.

 The slightly altered it, but for the most part, most dlc's for dragon age 2 follow the same rules as for Dragon age 1.

 Basically after the specific dlc data it should look like this.. 

ExtendedModuleUID="campaign_base" Priority="100" Enabled="1" State="2" Format="1" BioWare="0">

 Boot up game and poof, activated and working.. :)

Dear Dragon Age 2 Pirates

This torrent only includes the DLC for The Black Emporium and Exiled Prince. 

But it does not include a Decrypter needed to activate this DLC ingame. 

A DLC Decrypter for this game will be released in the week. 

Please remember, that changing the RequiresAuthorization="1"  to "0" will activate the DLC on the downloadable content in the main menu, but will not show in game.

So please be patient and a DLC decrypter will be available soon. 

Thank You and have a nice day.

to be able to install the dlc, simply launch DragonAge2Config.exe, and then go to repair and click all of the options there, it will basically add shortcuts & registry entries all by itself. You'll be able to then install the DLC's and HiRes textures afterwards. Hope it helps

You don't need a decrypter just do as follows:
1. Download torrent
2. Install both DLCs
3. Go to where ever you installed them to and right click on manifest.xml and click edit using notepad.
4. Change requiresauthorization="1"  to requiresauthorization="0"
5. Delete MID="200" leaving just one space between Bioware="1" and requiresauthorization="0"
6. Save, close, play
Hope this helped! :)

For people who've installed in program files:
run cmd.exe (as administrator) and start the .bat files that way.

For those who installed DA2 to program files and get the ".erf" file error; I managed to get it to work by granting myself full security access (DA2 install dir under properties). After this, run bat as administrator and it works.

I believe i am using the clonedvd file... well, i used the MDX torrent that was taken down on the 6th. Anyway, all i did was as most have done:

1. installed both DLC's
2. copied the manifests to their appropriate folders & overwrote originals
3. created and logged into EA account and checked they were installed in-game(they were)

HOW I GOT THIS SHIT TO WORK
=======================

1. Install DLC

2. Open manifest.mxl with notepad++

3. Replace the line RequiresAuthorization="1" with RequiresAuthorization="0"

4. Play

Note: This will not work if you are using the regular notepad, you have to use notepad++.
Also, I'm using the reloaded version if that makes any difference.

Confirmed to be working for the Black Emporium and Exiled Prince DLC
